summary: Multi-chain monitoring app for XRP Ledger projects tracking greedyjew issuer wallet (rdRvw4pKmEtSnz3cjXBL6HLJJmejtkoQ4) and project dev wallet (rw3DPxgusRrvdsbXSjHdXD14ogkNidTTRx) with drill-down interface: token list → token metrics → wallet holdings (Xaman-style data) → NFT viewer tab, using XRPL native DEX data and public APIs
architectural_notes: Use XRPL native DEX data and public APIs
Multi-chain monitoring architecture for XRP Ledger projects
Monitor two wallets: issuer wallet rdRvw4pKmEtSnz3cjXBL6HLJJmejtkoQ4 (GreedyJEW token issuer) and dev wallet rw3DPxgusRrvdsbXSjHdXD14ogkNidTTRx (project development wallet)
Filter displayed tokens to only those explicitly configured in whitelist, not all trust lines from monitored wallets
Split-screen layout: 50/50 split with token monitoring (left) and personal wallet view (right)
Fetch real-time XRP DEX order book prices for each monitored token to display current market trading prices
Top right network switcher for XRPL/Xahau (Xahau functionality to be implemented later)
Implement 50/50 split-screen layout: token monitoring (left) and personal wallet view (right)
Fetch real-time XRP DEX order book prices for each monitored token to display current market trading prices
Top right network switcher for XRPL/Xahau (Xahau functionality to be implemented later)

existing_features.title: Debug and fix the data fetching functionality so the dashboard displays wallet data for greedyjew and Hebroid wallets. Verify XRPL API requests are executing correctly and data is being returned from the public Ripple server.
Ensure the TokenList component correctly fetches and displays trust line data from both monitored wallets with proper error handling and loading states.
Verify the XRPL client library functions (getAccountInfo, getTrustLines, getAccountNFTs) are properly handling responses and returning data in the expected format for the components.
Add a 'Publish' button to the Dashboard header that allows the user to deploy the current application version

Update the XRPL client connection in frontend/src/lib/xrpl.ts to use a reliable public XRPL server endpoint (such as wss://xrplcluster.com or wss://s1.ripple.com) and implement proper connection error handling with retry logic

Validate that the wallet addresses 'greedyjew' and 'Hebroid' in frontend/src/components/TokenList.tsx are correctly formatted XRPL addresses (starting with 'r' and 25-35 characters long), and if they are usernames or identifiers instead, replace them with valid XRPL classic addresses

Add detailed error logging in frontend/src/lib/xrpl.ts for all API calls (getAccountInfo, getTrustLines, getAccountNFTs) that captures the full error response, request parameters, and network status to help diagnose fetch failures

Implement a user-friendly error state in frontend/src/components/TokenList.tsx that displays specific troubleshooting guidance when wallet data fails to load, including checking wallet addresses, verifying server connectivity, and viewing console logs

Replace the monitored wallet addresses in frontend/src/components/TokenList.tsx with the greedyjew issuer wallet (rdRvw4pKmEtSnz3cjXBL6HLJJmejtkoQ4) and the project dev wallet (rw3DPxgusRrvdsbXSjHdXD14ogkNidTTRx)

Update frontend/src/components/TokenMetrics.tsx to fetch token holdings from the greedyjew issuer wallet (rdRvw4pKmEtSnz3cjXBL6HLJJmejtkoQ4) and project dev wallet (rw3DPxgusRrvdsbXSjHdXD14ogkNidTTRx) when displaying token detail views

Update frontend/src/components/WalletHoldings.tsx to support viewing detailed holdings for both the greedyjew issuer wallet (rdRvw4pKmEtSnz3cjXBL6HLJJmejtkoQ4) and project dev wallet (rw3DPxgusRrvdsbXSjHdXD14ogkNidTTRx) with proper wallet identification in the UI

Create a token configuration interface in the frontend that allows the user to specify which tokens to monitor by entering token currency codes and issuer addresses, with the ability to add, edit, and remove tokens from the monitoring list

Update frontend/src/components/TokenList.tsx to filter trust line data based on the user-configured token whitelist, displaying only tokens that match the specified currency codes and issuer addresses instead of showing all trust lines from the monitored wallets

Pre-populate the token configuration with GreedyJEW (currency code to be determined from XRPL data, issuer rdRvw4pKmEtSnz3cjXBL6HLJJmejtkoQ4) and Jewnomican (currency code to be determined from XRPL data, issuer rEz5RdLqRex7YxYZ1bEskCDHbvKy3zcUnq) as the default monitored tokens
Add a navigation option or settings button to access the token configuration interface from the main dashboard
Add PLR (Pylons) token to the default token whitelist in frontend/src/lib/tokenConfig.ts with currency code 'PLR' and issuer address 'rNSYhWLhuHvmURwWbJPBKZMSPsyG5Qek17'

Add Schmeckles token to the default token whitelist in frontend/src/lib/tokenConfig.ts with issuer address 'rPxw83ZP6thv7KmG5DpAW4cDW55DZRZ9wu' and currency code to be determined from XRPL trust line data

Debug the whitelist filtering logic in frontend/src/components/TokenList.tsx to identify why trust line data from the monitored wallets (rdRvw4pKmEtSnz3cjXBL6HLJJmejtkoQ4 and rw3DPxgusRrvdsbXSjHdXD14ogkNidTTRx) is not matching against the configured token whitelist containing GreedyJEW, HEBROID, ASC, RPR, PLR, ARK, Schmeckles, MKS, and TriForce tokens

Fix the currency code and issuer address matching logic in frontend/src/components/TokenList.tsx to correctly filter XRPL trust lines against the token whitelist, handling both standard currency codes (3-character ASCII) and non-standard currency codes (40-character hex strings)

Add detailed console logging to frontend/src/lib/tokenConfig.ts getWhitelistedTokens() function to verify the whitelist is being loaded correctly from localStorage and contains all 9 expected tokens with their currency codes and issuer addresses

Verify that the currency codes stored in frontend/src/lib/tokenConfig.ts for GreedyJEW, HEBROID, Schmeckles, MKS, and TriForce match the actual currency codes returned in XRPL trust line data (which may be hex-encoded non-standard codes), and update them if necessary to ensure matching

Verify that the currency codes in frontend/src/lib/tokenConfig.ts DEFAULT_TOKENS array exactly match the currency codes returned in the XRPL trust line responses for all 10 tokens, and update any mismatched currency codes to use the correct hex-encoded or ASCII format as returned by the XRPL API

Update frontend/src/components/TokenMetrics.tsx to fetch and display all trust lines (layer 2 tokens) held by the selected wallet when viewing token details, in addition to the currently displayed token holdings breakdown
Add a collapsible or expandable section in frontend/src/components/TokenMetrics.tsx labeled 'Layer 2 Trust Lines' that displays underneath the current wallet holdings breakdown
Ensure frontend/src/components/TokenMetrics.tsx uses the existing getTrustLines function from frontend/src/lib/xrpl.ts to fetch all trust lines for each monitored wallet address

Add a flip switch toggle in the top right corner of the dashboard header (frontend/src/components/Header.tsx) that allows switching between XRPL and Xahau networks, with visual indication of which network is currently selected
Implement localStorage persistence for the last selected personal wallet in the right-side wallet area, automatically restoring the previously selected wallet when the user reopens the application
Implement a 50/50 split-screen layout on the main dashboard with monitored project tokens and DEX prices on the left side, and personal wallet holdings on the right side

Create a personal wallet selector and holdings display component for the right side of the dashboard that shows the selected wallet's XRP balance, token balances, and trust lines from the user's list of added wallets

Replace wallet balance information on the main token list (left side) with XRP-paired DEX trading prices for each monitored token, displayed in Xaman DEX price format, showing the current market price from XRPL DEX order books
Add 24-hour price change percentage display for each token on the left side dashboard to enable quick arbitrage opportunity scanning
Update the dev wallet label display logic to show 'Vault' specifically when viewing Schmeckles token data, while keeping 'Dev Hoard' as the default label for all other tokens
Create a wallet management interface that allows users to add, edit, and remove personal wallet addresses for monitoring, with the list stored in localStorage

new_feature_requests.summary: Token list view with drill-down navigation
Token metrics detail view
Wallet holdings view using Xaman-style data from XRPL APIs
NFT viewer tab
Track greedyjew and Hebroid wallets
Use the same XRPL native DEX data and public APIs as previously specified for tracking greedyjew and Hebroid wallets
Add token whitelist/configuration interface to specify which tokens to monitor instead of displaying all trust lines

Debug and fix the token whitelist filtering logic in frontend/src/components/TokenList.tsx to correctly match all 10 configured tokens (GreedyJEW, JewNomicaN, HEBROID, ASC, RPR, PLR, ARK, Schmeckles, MKS, TriForce, DeerChickenn) against the XRPL trust line data returned from wallets rdRvw4pKmEtSnz3cjXBL6HLJJmejtkoQ4 and rw3DPxgusRrvdsbXSjHdXD14ogkNidTTRx

Add comprehensive debug logging to frontend/src/components/TokenList.tsx filterTrustLinesByWhitelist function that logs: (1) the complete whitelist array with all currency codes and issuer addresses, (2) each raw trust line object before filtering with its currency and issuer values, (3) the comparison logic results showing whether each trust line matched or failed to match against whitelist entries, and (4) the final filtered trust lines count

Update the currency code matching logic in frontend/src/components/TokenList.tsx to support flexible matching that compares both hex-encoded and ASCII-decoded versions of currency codes, ensuring that tokens like 'GreedyJEW' match whether the XRPL returns the currency as ASCII or as a 40-character hex string
When clicking 'View More' on a token detail page, display the wallet's projects layer 2 trust lines as well as token balances
Display 24h price change percentage for each token on the left side dashboard for arbitrage opportunity scanning
Replace wallet balance display with XRP DEX trading prices on main dashboard token list (left side), matching Xaman DEX price format
Add network switcher (XRPL/Xahau) flip switch in top right corner of dashboard
Remember last selected personal wallet on app reload using localStorage
Change dev wallet label to 'Vault' specifically for Schmeckles token, keep 'Dev Hoard' as default for other tokens

Create personal wallet selector and holdings display component for the right side of the dashboard showing selected wallet's XRP balance, token balances, and trust lines from user's list of added wallets
Implement 50/50 split-screen layout on main dashboard with monitored project tokens and DEX prices on left side, and personal wallet holdings on right side
Create wallet management interface that allows users to add, edit, and remove personal wallet addresses for monitoring, with the list stored in localStorage
Add placeholder AI chatbot bubble popup interface (non-functional) that will later provide arbitrage opportunity suggestions
Remove AMONGSTT from the token whitelist and arbitrage comparison group

Remove AMONGSTT token entry from the DEFAULT_TOKENS array in frontend/src/lib/tokenConfig.ts, keeping the remaining 10 tokens (JewNomicaN, GreedyJEW, HEBROID, ASC, RPR, PLR, ARK, Schmeckles, MKS, TriForce, DeerChickenn) intact

Verify that any existing localStorage token configurations containing AMONGSTT are handled gracefully, allowing users who previously added AMONGSTT to continue seeing it until they manually remove it from their custom configuration
